Description: Rim, body, and ring foot fragment of North Ionian, possibly Clazomenian, pottery shallow dish or plate; cream slip on outside of lip and interior; glaze fired orange-brown; exterior: sets of three bands on wall and at join with foot; foot and underside reserved; blobs on outside of rim, stopt maeander band on top; interior:, from outside: band of alternating rosettes and tongues, some red; chequer pattern frieze between bands with traces of superimposed bands in added red and white; row of single dots; in tondo, alternate red and glaze crescents; two pre-firing holes in rim, one repair hole in body and one drill hole for sampling.
Curator's comments: NAA analysis carried out H. Mommsen (see Schlotzhauer & Villing 2006), sample Nauk 58, Group E indicates the fabric originated in North Ionia, possibly Clazomenae. For parallels regarding the decoration on the tondo, see Walter-Karydi, 1973, pl. 123, no. 996. See also Edinburgh A.1886.518.2 H.
Bibliographic references: Schlotzhauer & Villing 2006 / East Greek Pottery from Naukratis: The Current State of Research (p. 54, 57-8, fig. 6, Table 1)
Schlotzhauer 2012 / Untersuchungen zur archaischen griechischen Keramik aus Naukratis (p. 89, no. Nau 31, pl. 8a-b)
Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (GH.068) (phase 3)
